intro: Candollea calycina, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes plants like cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical forests. Candollea calycina is also known for its fibrous stems, which have been used traditionally in various local applications.
